poem:
### Clean Slate

In columns and print they lay entombed,  
old echoes of mistakes, ink-stained and shamed,  
the press of regret, like fingerprints of time,  
smudging pages that never fully fade.  
Now, erasers in hand, we pardon past ghosts,  
sift through stories, unburden their chains  
until their names, like autumn leaves,  
whisper away on winds of change.
